intro: Veronica carminea, commonly known as the carmine speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Veronica carminea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and easy maintenance.
